Hi Nathan.
I personally dislike a little anything that uses URI templating.=

In this case, always open to discussion, we have several URIs each represe=
nting one "service". You can either thing of it as one app in which you nee=
d to know the URIs beforehand to use it (or compose them like a template), =
or several apps, each one with one URI, that only return one particular val=
ue. I guess the second part does not violate any rule, still not sure we ar=
e taking advantage of all REST can provide. Maybe it is not needed. Maybe t=
he API is simply not that rich.

Cheers.

William.
